summary: The Treasury Department says it plans to upsize loans to airlines under a $25 billion federal program after major carriers Delta and Southwest decided to stick with the private market.
headline: Treasury Department could upsize airline loans as Delta, Southwest opt out, freeing up funds
China says manufacturing activity expanded in September
summary: China's official manufacturing Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) for the month of September came in at 51.5 as compared to 51.0 in August, according to the country's National Bureau of Statistics.
With more Americans spending time in the great outdoors amid the coronavirus pandemic, the trend has lead to a glut in inventory at recreational vehicle dealerships.
headline: Polaris, Thor Industries boost RV production as 'unprecedented demand' weighs on inventories

summary: The stock grant suggests that Cook's performance over the past decade is viewed highly by Apple's board, which wants to make sure that he will be paid competitively through 2025 if he continues to be the CEO of Apple.
headline: Apple CEO Tim Cook receives first major stock grant since 2011, could earn more than 1 million shares by 2025
The home cooking trend is 'becoming a habit,' says CEO of spice maker McCormick
summary: "We've gained market share in most of our categories, and this isn't just a U.S. phenomena. This is happening around the world. It's going to drive growth for a long time to come," McCormick CEO Lawrence Kurzius told CNBC.

headline: Stocks will return to record highs regardless of election outcome, $300M money manager predicts
summary: WealthWise Financial CEO Loreen Gilbert is building her bull case on the economic recovery.

headline: Wisconsin Ballot-Count Extension Upheld by Appeals Court
summary: A federal judge’s ruling that allows Wisconsin election officials to accept mail-in ballots for six days after Election Day in the battleground state can be implemented, a U.S. appeals court said.

headline: Chiefs-Ravens ESPN Monday night matchup averages 14 million viewers
summary: The game featured the last two NFL Most Valuable Players in quarterbacks Patrick Mahomes and Lamar Jackson and peaked at 16.2 million viewers.

headline: Jim Cramer on Peloton, Wayfair and other stocks with post-pandemic staying power
summary: "If the market's turned against your favorite Covid names, you can't expect them to come back any time soon," the "Mad Money" host said.

CNBC.com's MacKenzie Sigalos has the day's top business news headlines. On today's show, CNBC wealth editor Robert Frank breaks down the New York Times' massive review of President Trump's taxes, including the detail that he reportedly only paid $750 in federal taxes in 2016.
headline: Trump's tax bill takes centerstage ahead of big debate with Biden: CNBC After Hours
Stock futures open flat amid positive virus treatment data, debate looms
summary: U.S. stock futures opened flat on Tuesday night after the release of coronavirus treatment data from Regeneron Pharmaceuticals.

headline: Palantir reference price for direct listing comes in at $7.25 a share, NYSE says
summary: Palantir is scheduled to debut on the New York Stock Exchange on Wednesday in a direct listing of its shares.

headline: Disney to lay off 28,000 employees as coronavirus slams its theme park business
summary: Prolonged closures of Disney's California-based theme parks and limited attendance at its open parks has forced the company to lay off 28,000 employees across its parks, experiences and consumer products segment.

headline: Indoor farming start-up with Martha Stewart on its board joins the SPAC craze to go public
summary: "We're on a warpath here to change agriculture for the good, get chemical pesticides out, get labor practices we can all be proud of," AppHarvest CEO Jonathan Webb told CNBC.
Solomon's moves are the latest changes he has made to Goldman's structure nearly two years into his tenure atop the bank.
headline: Goldman Sachs CEO shuffles consumer banking, wealth management leaders
Ad exec Martin Sorrell says Facebook and Google shouldn't be broken up, boycotts pointless
summary: Famed advertising executive Martin Sorrell told CNBC that Google and Facebook have been exercising more responsibility and shouldn't be broken up by regulators.

headline: Amazon downplayed rising injury rates at its warehouses, investigation finds
summary: Amazon's injury rates were higher at warehouses with heavy automation, despite the company's claims that such technology would improve safety, Reveal found.
With Palantir and Asana's direct listings on deck, three market watchers break down what 2020's share issuances could mean for exchange-traded fund investors.
headline: It's a big week for public debuts. Here's how the flood could impact ETFs, per three market analysts

summary: As the number of deaths related to Covid-19 surpasses 1 million globally, it's clear that the pandemic will have continuing devastating effects on New York City's economy.
headline: New York City misses out on billions of tourism dollars as coronavirus keeps Broadway dark
United eyes return to JFK next year after a more than 5-year absence
summary: United left JFK airport in late 2015 in favor of Newark, where it dominates traffic.
